lessonSubtitleText: Test how well you know this story

answers: Everyone had to return to their hometown to sign his list
Everyone had to give money to Caesar
Everyone had to move to Rome
Everyone had to serve in the army

questions.text: What town did Mary and Joseph travel to? How far away was it?
answers: Bethlehem, about 70 miles
Jerusalem, about 10 miles
Nazareth, about 5 miles
Egypt, about 300 miles

questions.text: What happened to Mary in Bethlehem?
answers: She gave birth to a baby boy
She became very sick
She got lost
She became a shepherd

questions.text: Where did Mary lay baby Jesus?
answers: In a manger because there was no room
In a crib inside a house
In a tent outside the town
In a palace prepared for him

questions.text: What happened to the shepherds nearby?
answers: An angel appeared to them
They heard a loud storm
They saw a bright star
They fell asleep

questions.text: What good news did the angel tell the shepherds?
answers: The Christ had been born in Bethlehem
A new king was crowned in Rome
The shepherds would become rich
The war was over

questions.text: How could the shepherds know if the angel was telling the truth?
answers: They'd find a baby wrapped in cloths and lying in a manger
They would see a star fall from the sky
They would hear another angel speak
They would receive a letter from God

questions.text: Why would it be unusual to find a baby in a manger?
answers: A manger is a food box for animals, not a baby's bed
Mangers were only used outdoors
Mangers were very expensive
Mangers were used only by shepherds

questions.text: When the angel left, what did the shepherds do?
answers: They went into Bethlehem and found Mary, Joseph, and the baby
They went back to sleep
They sent messengers to Bethlehem
They ran away because they were scared

questions.text: What do we celebrate on Christmas?
answers: The coming of Jesus Christ, the chosen child come to save us
The day Rudolph saved Christmas
Santa's birthday
The Grinch
